Franklin Centre Leonard and Elm Street, showing the Tombs Prision.

J.E. Johnson.
1894.

#41 Lafayette Place.
August 23rd, 1902.
Wurts Bros.
:

41 Lafayette Place between North and Lenard Streets.
Wurts Bros.
August 23, 1902

#41 Lafayette Place, East Side.
Wurts Bros.
August 23rd, 1902

#41 Lafayette Place.
August 23rd, 1902.
Wurts Bros.

45 Lafayette Place, New York.
Geo. P. Hall & Son, General Photographers, 157 Fulton Street, New York. Telephone No. 2151 Cortlandt.
Gift of J. H. Jordan, Jan. 27, 1903.
[In later hand:] 434 Lafayette Avenue.

Lafayette Street, east side, from Pearl (right) to Worth (left) Street's, showing a shot tower to the rear of the Colwell Lead Co. plant. This and the surrounding buildings are shortly to be demolished and their sites included in the open municipal center, Foley Square.

About 1910

Gift of Ubrock Collection

117-119 Leonard Street, north side, between Lafayette Street and Benson Place, showing the 3-story building occupied by the Elliott Addressing Machine Company.
About 1924.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

Worth Street, north side, from Lafayette to Centre Streets. These buildings will be razed to provide a site for the new Dept. of Health Building.

September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Lafayette Street, west side, north from but not including Worth (left, not shown) to and including Leonard (right) Streets, showing the New York Life Insurance Co. Building, between Catherine Lane and Leonard Street. The excavation in the foreground, on the east side of Lafayette Street, is for the new Department of Health Building.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing also the north side of Leonard Street extending west to Broadway.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Lafayette Street, west side, north from but not including Worth (left, not shown) to and including Leonard (right) Streets, showing the New York Life Insurance Co. March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Lafayette Street, west side, north from and including Leonard Street.
September 24, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, at a later date, showing the block from Leonard to Franklin Streets. Also shown (right foreground) is a portion of the Tombs Prison, and (left fore) excavated area at the S.E. corner of Leonard Street, for the new Department of Health Building. In the background appears the N.Y. Telephone Co. Building undergoing renovations.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Lafayette Street, west side, north from and including Leonard Street.

(2)

Also shown (right foreground) is a portion of the Tombs Prison, and (left fore) excavated area at the S.E. corner of Leonard Street, for the new Department of Health Building. In the background appears the N.Y. Telephone Co. Building undergoing renovations.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Leonard Street, north side, east from Lafayette Street, to and including Centre Street, showing the Tombs. This view also shows Lafayette Street, east side, north from and including Leonard Street. The same view also shows Centre Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Leonard Street. March 26, 1931. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from the street level. About 1931.

(3) The same as View No. 1, but showing a comprehensive view northward on Lafayette Street, and a general view of the neighboring area. Excavated area seen on the south side of Leonard Street is for the new Department of Health Building. March 26, 1931.

(1) Leonard Street, north side, east from Lafayette Street, to and including Centre Street, showing the Tombs. This view also shows Lafayette Street, east side, north from and including Leonard Street. The same view also shows Centre Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Leonard Street. March 26, 1931. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from the street level. About 1931.

(1)
Worth Street, west from and including Lafayette Street. Also shown is Lafayette Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Worth Street. Note subway entrances on Lafayette Street.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a different angle. Note excavation for the new Dept. of Health Building, in the foreground.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Worth Street, west from and including Lafayette Street. Also shown is Lafayette Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Worth Street. Note subway entrances on Lafayette Street.
March 27, 1931.

(2)
The same, from a different angle. Note excavation for the new Dept. of Health Building, in the foreground.
March 27, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Excavation for the Department of Health Building covering the entire block of Worth Street, north side, between Lafayette and Centre Streets.
March 26, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view showing the completed building as seen from the Municipal Building. Also shown is a general view northward to the mid-town skyscraper zone.
August 21, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Excavation for the Department of Health Building covering the entire block of Worth Street, north side, between Lafayette and Centre Streets.
March 26, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view showing the completed building as seen from the Municipal Building. Also shown is a general view northward to the mid-town skyscraper zone.
August 21, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Worth Street (foreground, where construction work is in progress), north side, between Lafayette (left) and Centre (right) Streets, showing a view of construction work in progress on the new Building for the Department of Health, Hospitals and Sanitation. Directly north of same is the Tombs Prison. Also shown is a general view northward on Centre and Lafayette Streets from the Municipal Building. A portion of the New York State Office Building is visible in the right foreground, situated on the east side of Centre Street, from Worth to Leonard Streets.
May 3, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, showing an extensive view northward, with the mid-town Manhattan skyline in the background.
June 23, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as view No. 2, at a later date, showing the Department of Health Building in its completed form.
August 21, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

Worth Street (foreground, where construction work is in progress), north side, between Lafayette (left) and Centre (right) Streets, showing a view of construction work in progress on the new Building for the Department of Health, Hospitals and Sanitation. Directly north of same is the Tombs Prison. Also shown is a general view northward on Centre and Lafayette Streets from the Municipal Building. A portion of the New York State Office Building is visible in the right foreground, situated on the east side of Centre Street, from Worth to Leonard Streets.

Foley Square: The Board of Health Bldg. located at the northern side of this civic area. Technically this side is on the north side of Worth Street, between Centre (right) and Lafayette (left) Streets. Beyond same is the Tombs, which shortly is to be replaced at a new site.

June 12, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

No. 125 Worth St.

Leonard Street, east from Lafayette to Baxter Streets, and showing on the north side of same, the Tombs and a cleared area divided by Centre Street. Beyond this new Criminal Courts (and prison) Bldg. site is Columbus Park.
The Church spire seen is that atop the Transfiguration Roman Catholic Church in Chinatown and located at the N.W. corner of Mott and Park Streets.

P. L. Sperr

July 4, 1938.

Worth Street, north side, east from and across Lafayette Street, showing the Board of Health and the New York State Bldg. on opposite sides of Centre Street. These two structures form the northerly side of an open area surrounded by civic structures and called Foley Square in honor of a Tammany Sachem "Tim Foley".

June 12, 1938

P. L. Sperr

Worth Street, north side and west across Broadway from Lafayette Street.

P.L. Sperr, June 12th, 1938.

Leonard Street (right), north side, east from Lafayette, across Centre to Bayard Streets. Prominently shown is the Tombs prison occupying the square block north to Franklin Street. The latter thoroughfare separates this from the Criminal Courts, a portion of which appears at the upper left.

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

1939

"No. 25 Lafayette Place" p.87
Pelletreau, William S.
Early New York houses with historical - genealogical notes.
New York: Francis P. Harper, 1900.
